## Decision No. (149) of 2025
### Regarding a private marketing license for a collective investment scheme established outside the State of Kuwait, granted to KFH Capital Investment Company for marketing units of the KFH Capital Ijara Fund III LP

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and its executive regulations and their amendments;
- The Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association of KFH Capital Investment Company, and the agreement concluded between the representative of the collective investment scheme, KFH CAPITAL IJARA FUND III GP LIMITED, and the marketing manager, KFH Capital Investment Company;
- The request from KFH Capital Investment Company to conduct the private marketing of units of the KFH Capital Ijara Fund III LP;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of the final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

Has decided the following
### Article One
KFH Capital Investment Company is licensed to privately market 750 units (only seven hundred and fifty units) of the KFH Capital Ijara Fund III LP, established in the island of Guernsey, within the State of Kuwait. The offering price shall be determined at the time of the offering based on the ratio of the investor's capital contribution to the total capital contributions of all investors (the "Percentage Interests"), in addition to a subscription fee of 2% of the purchase price of each investment unit. The maximum total value offered in the State of Kuwait shall not exceed the amount of 150 million US Dollars (only one hundred and fifty million US Dollars).

### Article Two
The units to be marketed within the State of Kuwait shall be offered to professional clients only, as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities and their amendments. The entities receiving subscription applications shall be:
- KFH Capital Investment Company.
- Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>.

### Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on what is stated in the prospectus.

### Article Four
The duration of the marketing license is one year, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

### Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In the event of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

### Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Head of the Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

Issued on: 7 August 2025 M

# Administrative Decision GM 2025/119
Regarding the suspension of Sketch Engineering Consultants Office <orig>مكتب / اسكتش للاستشارات الهندسية</orig> – owned by Engineer / Maha Ahmed Taher Al-Baghli <orig>مها أحمد طاهر البغلي</orig>

**Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>**
- After reviewing Law No. (33/2016) concerning Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> and its amendments.
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (123/2021) issuing the regulations for the practice of the profession for engineering offices and consulting firms and its amendments.
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (363/2009) concerning the organization of the executive body of the Municipality and its branches in the governorates.
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (206/2009) concerning the regulation of construction works and its attached schedules dated 30/4/2009 and its amendments.
- And Administrative Decision No. (B 2025/84) dated 18/6/2025 regarding the reconstitution of the Committee for Regulating the Practice of the Profession for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms.
- And Administrative Decision No. (221/2023) dated 27/8/2023 regarding the renewal of the engineering office's registration.
- And Letter No. (01498/2025) dated 10/7/2025 from the Committee for the Practice of the Profession for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms.
- And the recommendation of the Committee in its meeting No. (5/2025) held on 23/6/2025 regarding the suspension of the engineering office.

**It is decided**

### Article One
To approve the recommendation made by the Committee in its meeting No. (5/2025) held on 23/6/2025 to temporarily suspend the Sketch Engineering Consultants Office <orig>مكتب / اسكتش للاستشارات الهندسية</orig> – owned by Engineer / Maha Ahmed Taher Al-Baghli <orig>مها أحمد طاهر البغلي</orig> – from supervision activities (for a period of 3 months) – based on the text of Article (29) of Ministerial Resolution No. (123/2021).

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, and it shall come into effect from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

**Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>**

Issued on: August 5, 2025 AD

Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>,
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection,
- Decree No. (238) of 2017 appointing the members of the Board of Directors of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>,
- Resolution No. (14) of 2021 issuing the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection; and its amendments,
- The economic concentration <orig>التركز الاقتصادي</orig> transaction No. (CPACNM000122025) concerning the acquisition by Sahibat Al-Khaldiya Real Estate Company <orig>شركة صاحبة الخالدية العقارية</orig> (L.L.C.) of 67.39% and Sanam Innovation Holding Company <orig>شركة سنام انوفيشن القابضة</orig> (L.L.C.) of 7.61% of the National Medical Company for Consumer Industries <orig>الشركة الوطنية الطبية للصناعات الاستهلاكية</orig> (K.S.C.C.) "NAMTED <orig>نامتيد</orig>",
- The report of the Executive Management <orig>الإدارة التنفيذية</orig> regarding the aforementioned economic concentration <orig>التركز الاقتصادي</orig> transaction,
- The approval of the Board of Directors in its meeting No. (102) held on 28/07/2025,
- And based on the requirements of the public interest <orig>مصلحة العمل</orig>.

It is decided

### Article One
To approve the economic concentration <orig>التركز الاقتصادي</orig> transaction No. (CPACNM000122025), in accordance with the following conditions and obligations:
1) The parties to the concentration shall be obligated to provide the Agency, within one month from the date of the transaction's completion, with copies of their contract templates with clients, ensuring that the provisions of the Competition Protection Law are observed.
2) The parties to the concentration shall be obligated not to impose any form of refusal to deal, withholding of products, obstruction of competition, or tying of products by making the conclusion of a contract or agreement conditional upon the acceptance of obligations that are not related to the subject matter of the transaction.
3) The parties to the concentration shall be obligated to uphold the principle of equal opportunity among competitors and not to discriminate between clients in contractual terms without justification.
4) The parties to the concentration shall be subject to continuous monitoring and evaluation by the Agency for a period of one year with regard to the prices and quality of the services provided.

### Article Two
The competent authorities – each within its jurisdiction – shall implement this resolution, notify all parties of this resolution, and it shall come into effect from the date of its issuance.
Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>

Issued on: 29 July 2025 AD

Whereas an error occurred in (Procedure: Dissolution and liquidation of the company).
The correction is (Procedure: Amendment of the legal entity from a One-Person Company to the new legal entity: a Limited Liability Company).
Therefore, we are republishing after correcting the error.
## Announcement
The owners of: Green Supply for Agricultural Supplies and Equipment Company
have submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships at the Ministry to carry out/
Amendment of the legal entity from: a One-Person Company to: the new legal entity
A Limited Liability Company.
Anyone with an objection should present it to the Court of First Instance within thirty days from the date of this announcement's publication, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection will result in the continued liability of the joint partners, in the case of a general partnership or a simple limited partnership only, towards this creditor until a final judgment is rendered on their objection.

Anyone with an objection should present it to the Court of First Instance within thirty days from the date of this announcement's publication, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection will result in the continued liability of the joint partners, in the case of a general partnership or a simple limited partnership only, towards this creditor until a final judgment is rendered on their objection.

# Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>

## Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee Meeting No. 20/2025, held on 22/07/2025

After reviewing the applications submitted to amend data in the birth and death records, it was decided to make the amendments listed below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the Committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

## Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee Meeting, held on 22/07/2025

The Births and Deaths Committee, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, has convened.

- Dr. / Chairman of the General Medical Council <orig>رئيس المجلس الطبي العام</orig> - Chairman
- Mr. / Director of the Central Registry of Births and Deaths Department <orig>مدير إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> - Member
- Mr. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>رئيس قسم البحوث والرأي</orig> - Member
- Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section <orig>رئيس قسم الوفيات</orig> - Member
- Mr. / Head of the Records Section <orig>رئيس قسم السجلات</orig> - Member
- Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig> - Member

The secretarial duties of the committee were performed by Mrs. Alia Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig>.

The Committee reviewed applications from No. ((258)) to No. ((270)) in the attached list, concerning the amendment of data in the birth and death records for unregistered birth and death cases. After examination and verification of the completion of documents and records, the Committee decides to announce the amendments and applications in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for two consecutive issues. If the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement passes without any objection being submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and birth and death certificates will be issued.

- Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>رئيس قسم البحوث والرأي</orig>

- Committee Secretary <orig>سكرتير اللجنة</orig>
- Chairman of the General Medical Council <orig>رئيس المجلس الطبي العام</orig>
- Director of the Central Registry of Births Department <orig>مدير إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد</orig>

## Announcement
Announcement of Pre-tender Offering for Limited Tender on a List of Companies
The Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> announces
the result of re-offering the permanent headquarters project for the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> - pre-qualification offering.
Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>

Firstly: The aforementioned pre-qualification result.
Secondly: Regarding the pre-tender offering for Tender No. (2026/2025/1) for the construction, completion, furnishing, maintenance, and operation of the Authority's main headquarters building.
The Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> wishes to draw the attention of the esteemed bidders to the fact that, based on the text of Article (16) of Law No. (49) of 2016, the aforementioned tenders will be offered to the companies listed in the attached disclosure, numbering (8) qualified companies (list of company names attached), only two weeks after the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette.
Anyone who applied for pre-qualification and whose name is not included in this list has the right to appeal before the Agency's Board of Directors against the decision of exclusion from the pre-qualification result or non-inclusion, within the period specified above, starting from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette, and after paying the fee specified by Ministerial Resolution No. (2017/114), along with submitting all data and documents attached to their request, provided that they are two identical copies.
No request or appeal received after the specified period or not fulfilling the required fees will be considered. The applicant must attach a copy of the receipt for payment of the prescribed fees with their appeal.

Secretary General of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>

# Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig>
## Announcement
## Regarding the Pre-tender Offering for Limited Tenders on a List of Companies

The Higher Purchasing Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its Subsidiaries announces, upon the request of Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig>, the offering of Tender No.:

**RFP-2145304**

Tender Title: **PROVISION OF SPECIALIZED & SUPPORT MANPOWER FOR INFRASTRUCTURE MASTER PLAN SERVICES**

In this regard, we draw attention to the fact that, based on the text of Article (16) of Tenders Law No. (49) of 2016 concerning Public Tenders, the aforementioned tender will be offered to the following list of (20) companies at least (30) days after the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and on the company's website. Any interested party whose name appears on the list of companies invited to tender may appeal against their exclusion or submit a request to participate in the tender, supported by relevant documents, addressed to Mr. / Chairman of the Higher Purchasing Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its Subsidiaries within (30) days from the date of this announcement:

K.D. only one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, non-refundable. Offers shall be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> in sealed envelopes, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (K.D. 10,000/-) ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (must be valid throughout the tender validity period of 90 days). The practice number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside, avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any identifying reference. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Wednesday, 10/9/2025.
- The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Wednesday, 20/8/2025, at 11:00 AM at the office of Mr./ Assistant Undersecretary for Radio and Television Affairs <orig>الوكيل المساعد لشئون الإذاعة والتلفزيون</orig> – Media Complex – Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig>, to answer inquiries submitted regarding the practice. Anyone who has purchased the tender documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. Everything recorded in the meeting minutes shall be considered an integral part of the tender documents and shall be binding on the bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their responses after approval to all bidders before the closing date for bids.
- Companies wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must submit them to the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> at the specified time and place for the preliminary meeting.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, 3 copies, with the exception of (the bid form template, initial security deposit, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the bidder's data form).
- The tender is indivisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend the bid opening session, after coordination with the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> before the scheduled date for the bid opening session.
- Attach a certificate of payment of subscriptions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> as stipulated in Article No. (95) of the Social Security Law <orig>قانون التأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>.
- A valid clearance certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the Ministry of Information's <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> file related to the registered labor force with the Authority. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded, in accordance with the circular of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> in this regard.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises (SMEs) are exempted from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with Article 39 of Law No. 74 of 2019 regarding amendments to Law No. 49 of 2016.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises (SMEs) wishing to apply for the tender must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development and Care <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, including their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise with the Fund.
- This announcement is considered an integral part of the tender documents.
- To obtain a copy, the bidder must register and pay the fees through the website https://eservice.media.gov.kw/purchase

# Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>
## Announcement
The owners of the company/restaurant and café, Smoking Cafe <orig>مطعم ومقهى سموكن كافيه</orig>, have submitted a request. The company is under liquidation.
A request was submitted to the Partnership Companies Department <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry to proceed with the dissolution and liquidation of the company. Legal entity: Limited Liability Company.
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of the announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the jointly liable partners in the case of a general partnership or simple limited partnership only, towards this creditor, until their objection is decided by a final judgment.

### Announcement
The owners of the company: Shabab Al-Matafi Restaurant <orig>مطعم شباب المطافي</orig>, a company under liquidation, submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry for the purpose of: dissolution and liquidation of the company. Legal entity: One-Person Company <orig>شركة الشخص الواحد</orig>.
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the joint partners, in the case of a general partnership <orig>التضامنية</orig> or simple limited partnership <orig>التوصية البسيطة</orig> only, towards this creditor, until a final judgment is rendered on their objection.

# Al-Burouj Real Estate Investment Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة البروج للاستثمار العقاري ش. م. ك (مقفلة)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Ordinary General Assembly of Al-Burouj Real Estate Investment Company <orig>شركة البروج للاستثمار العقاري</orig> was held at the company's headquarters – Al-Ghawali Complex at 1:30 PM on Thursday, 31/7/2025, to discuss the proposed agenda. In attendance was Mr. Ali Mohammed Ali Al-Kulaib <orig>على محمد على الكليب</orig> in his capacity as Deputy Chairman of the Board of Directors, with authorization to attend the Ordinary General Assembly from all shareholders, representing a 100% stake.
The attendance represented 150,000,000 shares by proxy out of a capital of 15,000,000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, original shares ---, for a total of 150,000,000 shares.
Also in attendance was Mr. Mohammed Adel Al-Waqayan <orig>محمد عادل الوقيان</orig> from the Gulf Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>. At the beginning of the meeting, the Deputy Chairman of the Board of Directors, Mr. Ali Mohammed Ali Al-Kulaib <orig>على محمد على الكليب</orig>, announced that the legal quorum required for the convening of the Extraordinary General Assembly was met. He then opened the meeting, welcomed the attendees, and proceeded to discuss the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly and deliberate its clauses as follows, and the following resolutions were passed:

First: Approval of the amendment of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association of the company.

**Current Text:**
1. Owning, selling, buying, and developing real estate and land for the company's account inside and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, as well as managing properties for others, all in a manner that does not violate the provisions stipulated in existing laws and the prohibitions on trading in private housing plots as stipulated by these laws.
2. Owning, selling, and buying shares and bonds of real estate companies for the company's account only in Kuwait and abroad.
3. Preparing economic feasibility studies and providing consultations in the real estate fields for the company's account only in Kuwait and abroad.
4. Owning and managing hotel establishments, health clubs, and tourist facilities, and leasing and renting them.
5. Carrying out maintenance work related to buildings and properties owned by the company and by others, including maintenance work and the execution of civil, mechanical, and electrical works, elevators, and air conditioning works, in a manner that ensures the preservation and safety of the buildings.
6. Managing, operating, investing in, leasing, and renting hotels, clubs, motels, guesthouses, rest houses, parks, gardens, exhibitions, restaurants, cafeterias, residential complexes, tourist and health resorts, recreational and sports projects, and shops of various grades and levels, including all original and ancillary services, attached facilities, and other necessary services.
7. Organizing real estate exhibitions for the company's real estate projects, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>.
8. Holding real estate auctions, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>.
9. Owning and managing commercial markets and residential complexes.
10. Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
11. Direct contribution to establishing the infrastructure for residential, commercial, and industrial areas and projects under the Build-Operate-Transfer (B.O.T.) system and managing facilities

**Proposed Text:**
real estate under the B.O.T. system.
1. Owning real estate and movables for the benefit of the company – 681091
2. Selling and buying land and real estate for the company's account only – 681011.
3. Selling and buying shares and bonds for the company's account – 649917
4. Management and development of land and real estate – 682022
5. Management and leasing of owned or rented real estate (residential) – 681021.
6. Management and leasing of owned or rented real estate (non-residential) – 681022.
7. Management and operation of hotel apartments – 681030.
8. Management and operation of hotels – 681031.
9. Management of properties for others – 682021.
10. Establishing or participating in companies with others to carry out the company's business – 642061
11. Building maintenance services – 811003
12. Project management – 821110
13. Public facility management – 811006.
14. Management and organization of exhibitions and conferences – 823004
15. Management and operation of projects under the PPP system – 821124
16. Investing financial surpluses in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies – 649918.
The company may carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or through an agent. The company may have an interest in or associate in any way with entities that engage in activities similar to its own or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, purchase, or affiliate with such entities.

The meeting concluded at 2:00 PM on the same day.
Deputy Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Asas International Holding Company <orig>شركة أساس الدولية القابضة</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

Held at 9:00 AM on Tuesday, 24/6/2025, at the company's headquarters located in Hawalli Governorate <orig>محافظة حولي</orig> – Salmiya <orig>السالمية</orig> – Al-Shamaliyah Tower – 17th Floor.
On Tuesday, 24/6/2025, the Extraordinary General Assembly of Asas International Holding Company <orig>شركة أساس الدولية القابضة</orig> was convened at 9:00 AM, with the attendance of shareholders in person and by proxy, totaling 8,548,951 shares out of 10,000,000 shares, representing a percentage of 85.489%.
Mr. Mohammed Abdullah Al-Ali <orig>محمد عبد الله العلي</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors, commenced the session by reading, reviewing, and discussing the agenda, whereupon approval was granted to amend Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (5) of the Articles of Association:

**Current Text:**
1. Owning shares in Kuwaiti or foreign shareholding companies, as well as owning shares or stakes in Kuwaiti or foreign limited liability companies, or participating in the establishment, management, and guaranteeing of these companies of both types with third parties.
2. Lending to companies in which it owns shares and guaranteeing them with third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the company must not be less than 20%.

# Tamdeen Shopping Centers Company (K.S.C. Closed)
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Tamdeen Shopping Centers Company held its meeting at 360 Mall at 11:00 AM on Wednesday, July 30, 2025. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Ahmed Abdulaziz Al-Sarraawi <orig>احمد عبد العزيز الصرعاوي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors.
A representative from the auditing firm Grant Thornton - Al-Qatami, Al-Aiban & Partners <orig>جرانت ثورنتون – القطامي والعيبان وشركاهم</orig> did not attend, nor did a representative from the Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>.
After the Chairman announced that the legal quorum for the assembly was met with the attendance of shareholders representing 836,772,068 shares in person and by proxy, constituting 83.68% of the capital, he began the meeting by welcoming the attendees and then proceeded to discuss the items on the agenda as follows:
* Amending Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association regarding the company's objectives.
Text before amendment:
1- Owning, selling, buying, and developing land and real estate for the company's account within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, as well as managing third-party properties, all in a manner that does not violate the provisions stipulated in existing laws and the prohibitions on trading in private housing plots as specified by these laws.
2- Owning, selling, and buying shares and bonds of real estate companies for the company's account only in Kuwait and abroad.
3- Preparing studies and providing consultations in all types of real estate fields, provided that the required conditions are met by those who practice this service.
4- Owning and managing hotels, health clubs, and tourist facilities, and leasing and renting them.
5- Carrying out maintenance work related to buildings and properties owned by the company and by others, including maintenance work and the execution of civil, mechanical, and electrical works, elevators, and air conditioning works, to ensure the preservation and safety of the buildings.
6- Managing, operating, investing in, renting, and leasing hotels, motels, guesthouses, rest houses, parks, gardens, exhibitions, restaurants, cafeterias, residential complexes, tourist and health resorts, recreational and sports projects, and shops of various grades and levels, including all primary and ancillary services, attached facilities, and other necessary services.
7- Organizing real estate exhibitions for the company's real estate projects, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
8- Holding real estate auctions, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
9- Owning and managing commercial markets and residential complexes.
10- Establishing and managing real estate funds (subject to the approval of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>).
11- Utilizing the company's surplus funds by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
12- Direct contribution to developing the infrastructure for residential, commercial, and industrial areas and projects under the "Build-Operate-Transfer" (BOT) system, and managing real estate facilities under the (BOT) system.
The company may carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or through an agent.
(The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that carry out activities similar to its own or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, purchase, or affiliate with such entities).

In addition to the shareholders, the session was attended by:

After confirming the quorum was met with the attendance of 99.188% of the company's capital, in person and by proxy, the Chairman of the Extraordinary General Assembly opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees and then proceeding to discuss the previously distributed agenda as follows:

1- The Extraordinary General Assembly approved the Board of Directors' recommendation to distribute bonus shares of 5% to the company's shareholders, at a rate of 5 shares for every 100 shares of the company's stock, and to increase the company's authorized, issued, and fully paid-up capital from KWD 10,000,000 (ten million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) to KWD 10,500,000 (ten million five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only). The increase will be through the distribution of bonus shares amounting to KWD 500,000, distributed as free shares allocated to the shareholders registered in the company's records as of the date of the General Assembly meeting. The Board of Directors is authorized to dispose of any fractional shares resulting from the distribution of the free bonus shares, as it deems appropriate.

2- The Extraordinary General Assembly approved the amendment of Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (5) of the Articles of Association, to state that the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is KWD 10,500,000, divided into 105 million shares, with a nominal value of 100 fils per share.

# Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>
## Announcement
### Issuance of Practice No. (M M /63/2024-2025)
Supply, Installation, Operation, Warranty, and Maintenance of Musical Instruments
For the needs of the General Technical Directorate for Music Education <orig>التوجيه الفني العام للتربية الموسيقية</orig>

The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the issuance of a (public) Practice for the supply, installation, operation, and warranty of musical instruments in accordance with the conditions and technical specifications in the Practice documents.

**General Instructions for the Practice:**
1- The Practice is (public) and open to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- Applicants for this Practice must be institutions/companies specialized in the works subject of the Practice within Kuwait, registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year. A certificate to this effect, with a date contemporary to the date of the Practice's issuance, must be attached to the bid.
3- This Practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers.
4- The fee for obtaining a copy of the Practice documents is (75) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.
5- The bid must be accompanied by a bid bond of not less than an amount of (2000) of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait, issued in the name of the bidder and for the benefit of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this bond, or accompanied by a bond that violates any of the aforementioned regulations, will be disregarded. The bond must be valid for the required bid validity period.
6- The total duration of the contract is two years from the date of signing the contract, during which the contractor is obligated to execute the works of the Practice in accordance with the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the Practice documents.
7- The bidder agrees that their bid shall remain valid and in effect, irrevocable, and may not be withdrawn from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the bid has been submitted.
8- If, upon studying the Practice, the practitioner finds any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or bills of quantities that affects their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will study these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any). This shall not result in any additional liability or obligation on the part of the Ministry.
9- The Practice documents shall be deposited in the Tender Box at the Procurement and Warehousing Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in the South Subhan area <orig>منطقة صبحان الجنوبي</orig> during official working hours, no later than (10) ten days from the date of publication of the announcement, at exactly (12:00 PM), in accordance with the decision issued by the Ministry regarding the change or extension of the closing date. No bid received after the specified closing time will be accepted, nor will any modification to the prices of submitted bids be considered after the bid has been submitted.
10- The practitioner must fill out the attached schedules and provide a statement of all supplies necessary for the execution of the works subject of the Practice – if any – within the same bid documents submitted. The Ministry has the right to reject the bid if it does not include the completed schedules in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the specifications and technical conditions of the Practice.
11- The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees <orig>كفالات مصرفية</orig> related to this Practice in the Arabic language.
12- Submission of samples is required.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education <orig>وكيل وزارة التربية</orig>

6- Attach a National Labor Support percentage certificate.
7- Tender documents can be obtained from the Ministry of Health's website.
8- The fees for purchasing the booklet can be paid through the website to be attached with the tender documents.
9- Price quotations must be submitted in a sealed envelope, including the tender documents, by the closing date specified on the Ministry of Health's website.

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction
The Clerks Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale by public auction of the property described below on Monday, 8/9/2025, in Hall 5 on the eighth floor of the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at 9:00 AM. This is in execution of the court ruling issued in Case No. 400/2023 Sales/1.
Filed by: Yusra Saad Ahmed Al-Nahidh <orig>يسرى سعد أحمد الناهض</orig>.
Against:
1- Khamis Yous Khamis Al-Sharrah <orig>خميس يوس خميس الشراح</orig>.
2- The Legal Representative of the Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>.

**– Property Description (According to the attached Certificate of Description)**

**\*\* According to the expert's report**
The disputed property located in the Al-Salam <orig>السلام</orig> area, Plot (3), Street (307), Building (6), was inspected as follows:
1: General Description of the Disputed Property:
The disputed property is physically located in the Al-Zahra'a <orig>الزهراء</orig> suburb – Plot No. (8) – Street (804) – Parcel No. (188) – House (5), with an area of 408 square meters and an automated number (19352284), and was inspected as follows:
The disputed property is a private residence located on two streets (a corner plot), clad in white and gray Sigma, with two entrances: a main entrance and a side entrance. It consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a half-floor on the second story.
– The disputed property conforms to the specifications stated in Document No. (10912) dated 10/10/2011, with an area of 408 square meters.
– The plaintiff stated that her ex-husband (the first defendant) is allocated the ground floor by virtue of a previous judicial ruling (spatial division of usufruct <orig>قسمة مهيأة مكانية</orig>), which prevented the plaintiff from enabling the expert to inspect the ground floor. She stated that the ground floor consists of a living room + master bedroom (with its bathroom) + two (2) bedrooms + a driver's room with its bathroom.

– The property of Document No. 10912/2011, located in the Al-Zahra'a <orig>الزهراء</orig> area – Parcel No. 188 – Plot No. 8 – Plan M/37768 – with an area of 408 m², will be sold by public auction with a starting price of KWD 426,465 (four hundred twenty-six thousand, four hundred sixty-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

**\*\* And according to the Certificate of Description:**
The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor + first floor + part of the second floor.

+ Three (3) bathrooms + main kitchen + laundry room.

- There is no elevator in the property.

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Execution Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability during the same session, based on the price at which the sale had been awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award shall be confirmed in their favor, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability on the basis of the price that had been awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This notice is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge (i.e., has performed due diligence).

Notice:
1- This sale notice is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> stipulates that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to issue a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

The Counselor <orig>المستشار</orig>

Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law states that "If the person whose ownership was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

The Counselor
Vice President of the Court of First Instance

The property subject of the lawsuit is a private residence consisting of a ground floor and a first floor, overlooking one street, and the building's condition is relatively old.

Real Estate Archives Controller <orig>مراقب المحفوظات العقارية</orig>

The preceding preamble is an integral part of this contract.
2. All parties to this contract acknowledge that they have reviewed the provisions of the company's articles of association and subsequent amendment contracts and have accepted all articles and provisions contained therein.
3. The partners agreed to amend the commercial name of the company to become / Al-Arbash Jewelry Company <orig>شركة الاربش للمجوهرات</orig> – a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig>.
4. The partners agreed to amend the legal entity of the company and convert it from a Limited Liability Company to a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) in accordance with the following articles:

## Article (1)
1. The preceding preamble is considered an integral part of this contract, complementary to it, and explanatory of its provisions, and it holds the same binding force as all its articles.
2. The signatories to this contract form a group whose purpose is to establish a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig> with a license from the Kuwaiti Government <orig>الحكومة الكويتية</orig> in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments, its executive regulations, and the articles of association attached to this contract.

## Article (2)
The founders acknowledge that the company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations, and the provisions of this contract. The company shall enjoy legal personality from the date of registration and may not engage in its activities except from the date of registration and the approval of all regulatory authorities for its engagement in its activities.

## Article (3)
The commercial name of the company is: Al-Arbash Jewelry Company <orig>شركة الاربش للمجوهرات</orig> – a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig>.

## Article (4)
The company's head office is located in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may transfer the head office to any other location within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.

## Article (5)
The duration of this company is unlimited and begins from the date of (registration), its entry in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and the publication of the official instrument of its establishment in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

## Article (6)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are to carry out the following:
1. Retail sale of jewelry and ornaments – Activity Code 477332.
2. Wholesale trade of gold and precious metals – Activity Code 466230.
3. Retail sale of gold ingots – Activity Code 477333.
4. Wholesale trade of gold ingots – Activity Code 464983.
The company may engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its purposes. The company may directly conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either as a principal or through agency. The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.

## Article (7)
The company's fiscal year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the company's first fiscal year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ends on December 31st of the following fiscal year.

## Article (8)
The company's authorized, issued, and fully paid-up capital is set at 4,612,342 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (only four million six hundred twelve thousand three hundred forty-two Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), distributed over 46,123,420 shares (only forty-six million one hundred twenty-three thousand four hundred twenty shares), with a par value of 100 fils (one hundred fils) per share. The company's capital consists of in-kind contributions that have been fully paid as follows:
4,612,342 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (only four million six hundred twelve thousand three hundred forty-two Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), in accordance with the valuation report issued by Al-Waha Auditing Office <orig>مكتب الواحة لتدقيق الحسابات</orig> – Chartered Accountants and Experts <orig>محاسبون قانونيون وخبراء</orig> dated 10/11/2024, a copy of which is attached.

The expenses, outlays, wages, and costs that the company is obligated to pay due to its establishment are approximately 5,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (only five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), to be deducted from the general expenses account.

## Article (2)
The Company's principal place of business and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may relocate the principal place of business to any other location within the State of Kuwait, and open branches and agencies for the Company inside and outside the State of Kuwait.

## Article (3)
The duration of this Company is indefinite and commences from the date of registration.

## Article (4)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the Company was established are to carry out the following:
1. Retail sale of jewelry and precious articles – Activity Code 477332.
2. Wholesale trade of gold and precious metals – Activity Code 466230.
3. Retail sale of gold ingots – Activity Code 477333.
4. Wholesale trade of gold ingots – Activity Code 464983.

The Company may engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its purposes. The Company may directly conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either as a principal or through agency. The Company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities to its own or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait or abroad. It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.

### B – Capital and Method of Increase

## Article (5)
The Company's authorized, issued, and fully paid-up capital is set at 4,612,342 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (four million, six hundred twelve thousand, three hundred forty-two Kuwaiti Dinars only), distributed over 46,123,420 shares (forty-six million, one hundred twenty-three thousand, four hundred twenty shares only), with a par value of 100 fils (one hundred fils) per share. The Company's capital consists of in-kind contributions that have been fully paid as follows:
4,612,342 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (four million, six hundred twelve thousand, three hundred forty-two Kuwaiti Dinars only), in accordance with the valuation report issued by Al-Waha Auditing Office <orig>مكتب الواحة لتدقيق الحسابات</orig> – Chartered Accountants and Experts, dated 10/11/2024, a copy of which is attached.

## Article (6)
The Company's shares are nominal and may be owned by non-Kuwaitis in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial resolutions regulating thereof.

## Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine the date of its implementation. However, by a resolution of the Company's Board of Directors, the issued capital may be increased within the limits of the authorized capital, provided that the issued capital has been fully paid. New shares may not be issued for less than their par value.

## Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the Company's authorized capital may be increased by a resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> after obtaining the approval of the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and a report from the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> in this regard, provided that the resolution issued for the capital increase specifies the amount and methods of the increase.

## Article (9)

If it is decided to increase the Company's capital, and some shareholders do not exercise their pre-emptive right to subscribe to the capital increase shares, the unsubscribed shares shall be allocated to those shareholders of the Company who wish to subscribe. If the subscription requests exceed the number of shares offered, they shall be allocated to the subscribers proportionally to their subscribed amount.
In all cases where the new shares are not fully subscribed, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders. The unsubscribed new shares shall be deemed cancelled by operation of law.

## Article (10)
The Company may increase its capital through public subscription, as stipulated in Article (160) of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

## Article (11)
A shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by the following two limitations:
1. Requiring a pre-emptive right for the Company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2. Requiring the approval of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for the buyer of the shares.
Dispositions referred to in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> are exempted from these two limitations.
(This provision does not apply to companies listed on the stock exchange.)

## Article (12)
Before disposing of their shares, a shareholder must notify the Company of the terms of sale. The disposition of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any shareholder submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder comes forward to purchase the shares, this must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.

## Article (13)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the Company's purchase of its own shares, if the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> rejects the buyer's person, it must purchase the shares on behalf of the Company within ten days from the date the Board is notified of the approval request. In this case, the purchase shall be made at the price agreed upon by the shareholder for selling their shares.

### Subscription

## Article (14)
The founders who signed the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the Company's entire capital in shares.

### Article (15)
Ownership of a share necessarily entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, the provisions of the company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, and the resolutions of its General Assembly <orig>جمعيتها العامة</orig>.

### Article (16)
Every share grants its owner the right to an equal share without discrimination in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits.

### Article (17)
The company shall maintain a special register <orig>سجل خاص</orig> with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by each, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded. Any changes occurring to the data recorded therein shall be endorsed in the shareholders' register <orig>سجل المساهمين</orig> in accordance with the information received by the company or the clearing agency. Any interested party <orig>ذي شأن</orig> may request the company or the clearing agency to provide them with data from this register.

## The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>

### Article (18)
Within three months from the date of completion of subscription <orig>الاكتتاب</orig> and before the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, the founders <orig>المؤسسين</orig> must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of subscribed shares, the payment of due installments by subscribers, the names and addresses of subscribers, the number of shares subscribed by each, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

### Article (19)
The founders <orig>المؤسسين</orig> must call for the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of completion of subscription <orig>الاكتتاب</orig>. If this period expires without the assembly being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the said period, call for the Constituent Assembly to convene.

### Article (20)
The invitation to attend the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be issued by one of the following methods:
1. Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2. Announcement, which must be made twice, with the second announcement taking place at least seven days after the publication date of the first announcement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3. Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4. Sending the invitation via email and fax, provided that the second invitation is sent at least seven days after the date of the first invitation and at least seven days before the meeting.

The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening, for its representative to attend. The Constituent Assembly meeting shall be chaired by the person elected by the Assembly for this purpose.

### Article (21)
The meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders with voting rights representing more than half of the subscribed shares. If this quorum <orig>النصاب</orig> is not met, the Assembly must be called for a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of not less than seven days and not more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
A new invitation for the second meeting may not be required if its date was specified in the invitation for the first meeting. Resolutions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

### Article (22)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> shall submit to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information on all incorporation <orig>التأسيس</orig> operations and the amounts expended, along with supporting documents. This report shall be placed in a location designated by the founders for subscribers to review, at least seven days before the Assembly meeting, and this shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting.

### Article (23)
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1. Approving the company's incorporation <orig>تأسيس الشركة</orig> procedures after verifying their validity and conformity with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2. Approving the valuation of in-kind shares <orig>الحصص العينية</orig>, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law.
3. Electing the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members.
4. Selecting the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> and determining their fees.
5. Declaring the final incorporation <orig>تأسيس الشركة</orig> of the company.

A copy of the minutes of the Constituent Assembly meeting, including the resolutions adopted, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must publish the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.

### Article (24)
## Rights and Obligations of Shareholders <orig>حقوق والتزامات المساهمين</orig>
A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
1. Receiving profits and obtaining bonus shares <orig>أسهم المنحة</orig> decided for distribution.
2. Participating in the company's management through membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and attending General Assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig> and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and these Articles. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3. Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly meeting, the company's financial statements <orig>البيانات المالية</orig> for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the auditor's report.
4. Disposing of shares owned by them and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5. Receiving a share of the company's assets upon liquidation <orig>التصفية</orig> after settling its debts.

### Article (25)
A member of the company shall specifically be obligated to:
1. Pay the installments due on their shares upon their due dates and pay compensation for delay in payment.
2. Pay the expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments of their share value, and the company may execute on the shares to satisfy its rights.
3. Implement the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
4. Refrain from any act that would harm the financial or moral interests of the company.
<page_end>165</page_end>

### Article (26)
The General Assembly of Shareholders may not do the following:
1. Increase the financial burdens of the shareholder or increase the nominal value of the share.
2. Decrease the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as specified in the company's contract.
3. Impose new conditions, other than those mentioned in the Memorandum of Association or these Articles, related to the shareholder's right to attend and vote in General Assemblies.
Deviation from these provisions is permissible with the written consent of all shareholders or by a unanimous vote in which all shareholders participate, and upon completion of the necessary procedures to amend the company's contract.

### Article (27)
**Company Management**
**A- Board of Directors**
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of (3) members (only three members). The term of membership shall be three years, renewable. If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors on the specified date, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's business until the reasons preventing the election are resolved and a new Board of Directors is elected.

### Article (28)
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot. The company's contract may stipulate that a number not exceeding half of the first Board of Directors members be elected from among the company's founders.

### Article (29)
The Board of Directors shall elect, by secret ballot, a Chairman and a Vice-Chairman. The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to the other powers specified in the contract. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors in the company's relations with third parties. He must implement the Board's decisions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman shall replace the Chairman in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

### Article (30)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer appointed by the Board of Directors from among the Board members or from outside, who shall be entrusted with the management of the company. The Board shall determine his remuneration and his powers to sign on behalf of the company.

### Article (31)
The Board of Directors may distribute the work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to carry out one or more specific tasks, to supervise an aspect of the company's activities, or to exercise some of the authorities or powers vested in the Board.

### Article (32)
Every shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of Board members chosen in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board, except to the extent of their shareholding that exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representatives on the Board. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives on their behalf to the Board of Directors, in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and obligations as elected members. The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

### Article (33)
A meeting of the Board of Directors shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern means of communication, and resolutions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during a single year. A greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

### Article (34)
The minutes of the Board of Directors' meetings shall be recorded and signed by the members present and the secretary of the Board. A member who does not agree with a resolution passed by the Board may have his objection recorded in the minutes of the meeting.

### Article (35)
If a position on the Board of Directors becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the most votes among those who were not elected to the Board. If that person is unable to serve, the next in line shall take their place. The new member shall only complete the term of their predecessor.
However, if the number of vacant positions reaches one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors must call for a General Assembly of Shareholders to convene within two months from the date the last position became vacant, to elect members to fill the vacant positions.

### Article (36)
A candidate for membership on the Board of Directors must meet the following conditions:
1. Must have the legal capacity to act.
2. Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a penalty restricting freedom, or a crime of bankruptcy by negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or integrity, or a penalty restricting freedom for violating the provisions of this law, unless he has been rehabilitated.
3. Must personally own, or the person he represents must own, a number of the company's shares.
If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the preceding conditions, his membership shall be terminated.

### Article (37)
Membership on the company's Board of Directors is not included within the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234). A person may be the Chairman of the Board of Directors of more than one closed joint-stock company.

### Article (38)
The Chairman or a member of the Board of Directors, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of his position to gain a benefit for himself or for others.
A member of the Board of Directors may dispose of his shares in the company during his membership on the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law, the company's contract, or these Articles.

### Article (39)
Members of the Board of Directors may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly meetings, or to third parties any company secrets they have become aware of in the course of their management duties. Otherwise, they shall be subject to removal and held liable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.

### Article (40)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any of its members may not hold a board membership in two competing companies, participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for his own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity pursued by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to claim compensation from him or to consider the transactions he conducted for his own account as having been conducted for the company's account, unless this is done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly.

## Article (41)
The total remuneration of the Chairman and members of the Board of Directors may not be estimated at more than ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation, reserves, and distributing a profit of not less than (5%) of the capital to the shareholders. Annual bonuses not exceeding six thousand dinars may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors and to each member of this board from the date of the company's incorporation until it achieves profits that allow it to distribute bonuses in accordance with the provisions of the preceding paragraph. The Board of Directors is obligated to submit an annual report to the company's ordinary general assembly for approval, which must include a precise and detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages received by the Board of Directors, whatever their nature or designation.

## Article (42)
A person who has a representative on the Board of Directors, or the Chairman, a member of the Board of Directors, a member of the executive management, or their spouses or second-degree relatives, may not have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and transactions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a license issued by the ordinary general assembly.

## Article (43)
The company may not grant a loan to a member of its Board of Directors, the Chief Executive Officer, their spouses, their relatives up to the second degree, or their subsidiary companies, unless there is an authorization from the company's ordinary general assembly. Any transaction made in violation of this shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of bona fide third parties.
(This provision does not apply to companies that are permitted to grant loans)

## Article (44)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors and its members are liable to the company, the shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of power, any violation of the law or the company's contract, and for mismanagement. A vote by the general assembly to discharge the Board of Directors from liability shall not prevent the filing of a liability lawsuit. Members of the Board of Directors may not participate in voting on general assembly resolutions related to discharging them from liability for their management, or those related to a special interest for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or a dispute between them and the company.

## Article (45)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either a personal liability incumbent upon a specific member, or a joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors. In the latter case, the members shall be jointly and severally liable for paying compensation, except for any member who objected to the resolution that gave rise to the liability and had their objection recorded in the minutes.

## Article (46)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors for errors that result in damages to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake the filing of the lawsuit.

## Article (47)
Any shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party to the lawsuit so that compensation may be awarded to it, if warranted. A shareholder may also file a personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them personal harm. Any agreement to the contrary shall be void.

## Article (48)
### B - The General Assembly
The annual ordinary general assembly shall convene at the invitation of the Board of Directors within the three months following the end of the fiscal year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may call the general assembly to meet whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must call the assembly to meet upon a reasoned request from a number of shareholders holding ten percent of the company's capital, or upon the request of the auditor, within twenty-one days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the party calling for the meeting.
The procedures for calling the general assembly, the quorum for attendance, and voting shall be subject to the provisions for the constituent assembly as stipulated in the Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its amendments.

## Article (49)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of shares they hold, has the right to attend the general assembly, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes assigned to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote, either for themselves or on behalf of a person they represent, on matters related to a special interest for them, or a dispute between them and the company. Any condition or resolution to the contrary shall be void. A shareholder may appoint another person to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose.
A person who claims a right to shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of summary matters to obtain an order on a petition to prohibit the disputed shares from voting for a period determined by the judge or until the competent court rules on the substance of the dispute, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.

## Article (50)
The general assembly meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors, his deputy, a person delegated by the Board of Directors for that purpose, or a person elected by the general assembly from among the shareholders or others.

## Article (51)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the ordinary general assembly, in its annual meeting, is competent to adopt resolutions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, including, in particular, the following:
1. The Board of Directors' report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended fiscal year.
2. The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3. A report on any violations detected by regulatory authorities for which penalties have been imposed on the company.
4. The company's financial statements.
5. The Board of Directors' proposals regarding the distribution of profits.
6. Discharging the members of the Board of Directors from liability.
7. Electing or removing members of the Board of Directors and determining their remuneration.
8. Appointing the company's auditor and determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors to do so.
9. A report on transactions that have been or will be conducted with related parties. Related parties are defined in accordance with International Accounting Standards.

## Article (52)
By a resolution issued by the company's ordinary general assembly, the Chairman, one or more members of the Board of Directors may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors may be dissolved and a new board elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders holding no less than one-quarter of the capital
<page_end>167</page_end>
