Upon the issuance of a resolution to dissolve the Board of Directors, and if it is not possible to elect a new board in the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either that the current board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until a new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary administrative committee whose primary mission shall be to call for a General Assembly to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

## Article (53)
The Ordinary General Assembly may not discuss topics not listed on the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or were revealed during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority, the auditor, or a number of shareholders holding five percent of the company's capital. If it becomes apparent during the discussion that there is insufficient information regarding some of the matters presented, the meeting shall be postponed for a period not exceeding ten business days if requested by a number of shareholders representing one-quarter of the issued share capital. The postponed meeting shall convene without the need for new convocation procedures.

## Article (54)
The Board of Directors must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly, unless such resolutions are in violation of the law, the Memorandum of Association, or these Articles. The Board of Directors must re-present the violating resolutions to the General Assembly in a meeting convened to discuss the aspects of the violation.

## Article (55)
The provisions relating to the Ordinary General Assembly shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

## Article (56)
The Extraordinary General Assembly shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors, or upon a reasoned request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital, or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors must call the Extraordinary General Assembly to convene within thirty days from the date of submitting the request. If the Board of Directors does not call the Assembly to convene within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry shall call for the meeting within a period of fifteen days from the expiry date of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

## Article (57)
A meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued share capital.
If this quorum is not met, a call shall be made for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by shareholders representing more than half of the issued share capital. Resolutions shall be passed by a majority of more than half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

## Article (58)
Without prejudice to other powers stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly shall have jurisdiction over the following matters:
1. Amending the company's contract.
2. Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other manner.
3. Dissolving, merging, transforming, or dividing the company.
4. Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.

## Article (59)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly shall not be effective until after the publication procedures have been completed. The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, its purposes, or its capital.

## Article (60)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit to nullify any resolution issued by the Board of Directors or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly that violates the law, the company's Memorandum of Association, or these Articles, or was intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation where applicable.
It is also permissible to challenge resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assembly that are prejudicial to the rights of the minority. The challenge may be made by a number of company shareholders who own fifteen percent of the company's issued capital and who did not approve of those resolutions.

## Company Accounts
## Article (61)
The company's fiscal year shall begin on the first of January and end on the last of December of each year, with the exception of the first fiscal year, which shall begin from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register and end on December 31 of the following fiscal year.

## Article (62)
A percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted annually by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly, based on a proposal by the Board of Directors, to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The Assembly may suspend this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to secure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not permit the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of a voluntary reserve that allows for the distribution of this percentage of profits. Any amount deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years permit, unless this reserve already exceeds half of the issued capital.
Additionally, one percent (1%) of the company's net profit shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.

## Article (63)
A percentage shall be deducted annually from the gross profits, to be determined by the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities, or for their repair. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

## Article (64)
The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the obligations incumbent upon the company under labor and social security laws. A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

## Article (65)
A percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal by the Board of Directors, to form a voluntary reserve to be allocated for purposes determined by the Ordinary General Assembly.

## Article (66)
The General Assembly may, upon a proposal from the Board of Directors, distribute profits to the shareholders at the end of the fiscal year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and must not affect the company's paid-up capital.

## Article (67)
## The Auditor
The provisions of the articles contained in the Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 shall apply, starting from Article No.

## Article (68)
At the end of each fiscal year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet and profit and loss statements for itself and all its subsidiaries, accompanied by the clarifications and data required by International Accounting Standards.

## Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
## Article (69)
The company shall be dissolved for any of the reasons stipulated in Articles 266 to 277 of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its Executive Regulations.

## Article (70)
The liquidation of the company shall be conducted in the manner set forth in the provisions of Articles 278 to 295 of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its Executive Regulations.

## Article (71)
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, its amendments, and its Executive Regulations shall apply to all matters for which no special provision is made in the Articles of Association or in these Bylaws.

## Article (72)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's head office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file at the competent department of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

## Article (73)
The founders declare the following:
First: That they have subscribed to all shares and have deposited the legally required portion of their value in a local bank at the disposal of the company.
Second: That the in-kind contributions have been valued in accordance with the provisions of the law, and have been fully paid.
Third: That they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies to manage the company.
Fourth: The papers and documents supporting the aforementioned declarations are kept with the official record.

## Article (74)
This contract was drawn up based on the letter from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> No. 2012202436009 and registered with the Contracts and Companies Control Department <orig>مراقبة العقود والشركات</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> under automated number 6423415 on 21/4/2025.

### Article (5)
The duration of the company is indefinite, commencing from the date of its registration.

### Article (6)
Without prejudice to the provisions of the Companies Law by Decree No. 1 of 2016 and its amendments and executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
First – Web design (631201)
Second – Custom software design and programming (620102)
Third – Software maintenance and website page design (620103)
The company may carry out all or some of these purposes in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad, either directly or through an agent. The company may have an interest in or associate in any way with entities and companies that conduct similar business or that assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, purchase, or annex such entities or companies.

### Article (7)
The company's fiscal year begins on the first of January and ends on the 31st of December of each year, with the exception of the first fiscal year, which shall begin from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register and end on the 31st of December of the following fiscal year.

### Article (8)
The company's authorized capital is set at KWD 2,100,000 (two million one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), divided into 21,000,000 shares (twenty-one million shares), with a value of 100 fils per share. All shares are cash shares. The issued capital is KWD 2,100,000 (twenty-one million shares). The company's capital consists of cash shares paid as follows:
The paid-up capital is KWD 525,000 (five hundred twenty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), which was paid by the company to the Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك التجاري الكويتي</orig> pursuant to the letter issued on 09/07/2025 G.

A – Elements of Company Establishment

First – Web design (631201)Second – Custom software design and programming (620102)

The company may have an interest in or associate in any way with entities and companies that conduct similar business or that assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, purchase, or annex such entities or companies.

### B – Capital and Methods of its Increase
The authorized capital is set at KWD 2,100,000 (Two million one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), the issued capital is KWD 2,100,000 (Two million one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), and the paid-up capital is KWD 525,000 (Five hundred twenty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), which was paid in cash to the Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك التجاري الكويتي</orig> pursuant to the letter issued by the bank on 09/07/2025 G.

## Article (6)
The company's shares are nominal. Non-Kuwaitis (may) own them in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial resolutions regulating this.

## Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The extraordinary general assembly may authorize the board of directors to determine the date of its implementation. However, by a decision of the company's board of directors, the issued capital may be increased within the limits of the authorized capital, provided that the issued capital has been fully paid.
New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value.

## Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the company's authorized capital may be increased by a resolution issued by the extraordinary general assembly, after the approval of the regulatory authorities, based on a reasoned proposal from the board of directors and a report from the auditor in this regard. The resolution to increase the capital must include the amount and methods of the increase.

## Article (9)
If it is decided to increase the company's capital and some shareholders do not exercise their pre-emptive right to subscribe to the capital increase shares, the unsubscribed shares shall be allocated to those company shareholders who wish to subscribe. If the subscription requests exceed the number of shares offered, they shall be allocated to the subscribers in proportion to their subscription.
In all cases where the new shares are not fully subscribed, the board of directors may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders, and the unsubscribed new shares shall be considered canceled by force of law.

## Article (10)
The company may increase its capital through a public offering as set out in Article (160) of the Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

## Article (11)
A shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by one or both of the following two restrictions:
1 – A condition of pre-emptive right for the company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2 – A condition of approval from the board of directors for the purchaser of the shares.
The transactions referred to in Article (172) of the Companies Law are excluded from these two restrictions.
(This provision does not apply to companies listed on the stock exchange).

## Article (12)
Before disposing of their shares, the shareholder must notify the company of the terms of the sale. The disposal of shares shall not be effective until ten days have passed from the date of notification without any shareholder submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder comes forward to purchase the shares, it must be done at the price stated in the terms of the sale.

## Article (13)
Without prejudice to the provisions related to the company's purchase of its own shares, if the board of directors rejects the purchaser, it must purchase the shares for the company's account within ten days from the date the board was notified of the request for approval. In this case, the purchase shall be made at the price at which the shareholder agreed to sell their shares.

## Article (14)
Subscription
The founders, signatories to the Articles of Incorporation, have subscribed to the entire capital of the company with a total of 21,000,000 shares (Twenty-one million shares) with a nominal value of 100 fils (One hundred fils per share), distributed among them according to their respective subscription percentages as shown in the Articles of Incorporation. An amount of KWD 525,000 (Five hundred twenty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) of the nominal value of the shares they subscribed to has been paid to the (Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>التجاري الكويتي</orig>), pursuant to the attached bank certificate dated 09/07/2025 G.
The remaining portion of the share value shall be paid within a maximum period of five years from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register, and on the dates determined by the board of directors. If a shareholder delays payment of the installment due on the shares on its due date, the company must, after fifteen days from the date of notifying them, offer their shares for sale to the other shareholders. The company shall recover from the proceeds of the share sale, with priority over all the shareholder's creditors, the value of the unpaid installments, interest, and any expenses incurred by the company. The remainder shall be returned to the shareholder. If the proceeds from the sale of the shares are insufficient, the company shall have recourse against the shareholder for the remainder from their personal assets.

## Article (15)
Ownership of a share automatically entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Incorporation, the provisions of the company's Articles of Association, and the resolutions of its general assemblies.

## Article (16)
Each share entitles its holder to a share equal to that of others, without discrimination, in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits.

## Article ( 23 )

The Constituent Assembly shall have competence in the following matters:
1. / Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and compliance with the provisions of the Companies Law and the company's contract.
2. / Approving the valuation of in-kind contributions, if any, as set forth in Article (11) of the Companies Law.
3. / Electing the members of the first Board of Directors.
4. / Selecting the auditor and determining their fees.
5. / Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Constituent Assembly meeting, including the resolutions adopted, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة و الصناعة</orig>.
The first Board of Directors must publish the company's contract and register it in the Commercial Register within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.

## Article ( 24 )

Rights and Obligations of Shareholders
A member of the company shall, in particular, enjoy the following rights:-
1. / Receiving profits and obtaining bonus shares that are decided to be distributed.
2. / Participating in the management of the company through membership on the Board of Directors and attending General Assemblies and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law and these Articles of Association. Any agreement to the contrary shall be void.
3. / Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly meeting, the company's financial statements for the past accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the auditor's report.
4. / Disposing of the shares they own and having priority in subscribing to new shares.
5. / Obtaining a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after the settlement of its debts.

## Article ( 25 )

A member of the company shall, in particular, be obligated to the following:
1. / Paying the due installments on the shares they own upon their due dates and paying compensation for any delay in payment.
2. / Paying the expenses incurred by the company in the course of collecting unpaid installments of the value of their shares, and the company has the right to execute against the shares to satisfy its rights.
3. / Complying with the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly.
4. / Refraining from any act that would harm the financial or moral interests of the company and undertaking to compensate for damages arising from such violation.

## Article ( 26 )

The General Assembly of Shareholders may not do the following:
1. / Increase the financial burdens of the shareholder or increase the nominal value of the share.
2. / Decrease the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as specified in the company's contract.
3. / Impose new conditions, other than those mentioned in the Memorandum of Association or these Articles of Association, related to a shareholder's right to attend and vote in General Assemblies.

## Article ( 17 )

The company shall have a special register kept with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of the shareholders, their nationalities, their domiciles, the number of shares owned by each of them, their type, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes to the data recorded in the shareholders' register shall be noted therein in accordance with the information received by the company or the clearing agency. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency to provide them with data from this register.

## Article ( 18 )

The Constituent Assembly
Within three months from the date of subscription and before the Constituent Assembly meeting, the founders must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة و الصناعة</orig> a statement with the number of shares subscribed to, the payment by the subscribers of the due installments, the names and addresses of the subscribers, the number of shares subscribed to by each, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

## Article ( 19 )

The founders must call for the Constituent Assembly to convene within three months from the date of the completion of the subscription. If this period elapses without the assembly being convened, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة و الصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the expiry of the said period, call for the Constituent Assembly to convene.

## Article ( 20 )

The invitation to attend the Constituent Assembly meeting, including the agenda and the time and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1. – Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2. – Advertisement, which must be published twice. The second advertisement must be published after a period of not less than seven days from the date of the first advertisement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3. – Hand-delivery of the invitation to the shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting date, with an acknowledgment of receipt noted on a copy of the invitation.
4. – Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations of the Companies Law. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, time, and place of the meeting at least seven days before it is held for its representative to attend.
The Constituent Assembly meeting shall be chaired by a person elected by the Assembly for this purpose.

## Article ( 21 )

The Constituent Assembly meeting shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders with voting rights representing more than half of the subscribed shares. If this quorum is not met, the Assembly must be called for a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of not less than seven days and not more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
A new invitation for the second meeting may be omitted if its date was specified in the invitation for the first meeting. Resolutions shall be passed by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

## Article ( 22 )

The founders shall submit to the Constituent Assembly a report containing comprehensive information on all incorporation operations and the amounts spent, along with the supporting documents. This report shall be placed in a location specified by the founders for the subscribers to review before the meeting

## Article (27)
A - Board of Directors
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of (3) members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors on the specified date, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's business until the reasons preventing the election are resolved and a new Board of Directors is elected.

## Article (28)
The shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot. The company's contract may stipulate that a number not exceeding half of the members of the first Board of Directors be elected from among the company's founders.

## Article (29)
The Board of Directors shall elect, by secret ballot, a Chairman and a Vice-Chairman. The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to the other powers specified in the contract. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors in the company's relations with third parties. He must implement the Board's decisions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman shall replace the Chairman in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

## Article (30)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer appointed by the Board of Directors from among the Board members or from outside, who shall be entrusted with the management of the company. The Board shall determine his remuneration and his powers to sign on behalf of the company.

## Article (31)
The Board of Directors may distribute the work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to carry out one or more specific tasks, to supervise an aspect of the company's activities, or to exercise some of the authorities or powers vested in the Board.

## Article (32)
Every shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of Board members chosen in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board, except to the extent of their shareholding that exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representatives on the Board. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives on their behalf to the Board of Directors, in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and obligations as the elected members.
The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

## Article (33)
A meeting of the Board of Directors shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern means of communication, and resolutions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during a single year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

## Article (34)
The minutes of the Board of Directors' meetings shall be recorded and signed by the members present and the secretary of the Board. A member who did not agree to a resolution passed by the Board may have his objection recorded in the minutes of the meeting.

## Article (35)
If a position on the Board of Directors becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the most votes among those who were not elected to the Board of Directors. If that person is unable to serve, the next person in line shall take their place. The new member shall only complete the term of their predecessor.
However, if the number of vacant positions reaches one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors must call for a General Assembly of shareholders to convene within two months from the date the last position became vacant, to elect members to fill the vacant positions.

## Article (36)
A candidate for membership of the Board of Directors must meet the following conditions:
1- To have the legal capacity to act.
2- Not to have been previously convicted of a felony with a penalty restricting freedom, or a crime of bankruptcy by default or fraud, or a crime against honor or integrity, or a penalty restricting freedom for violating the provisions of the law, unless he has been rehabilitated.
3- To be a personal owner, or the person he represents to be an owner, of a number of the company's shares.
If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the preceding conditions, his membership shall be terminated.

## Article (37)
Membership on the company's Board of Directors shall not be included within the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234) of the Companies Law.
A person may be the Chairman of the Board of Directors of more than one closed joint-stock company.

## Article (38)
The Chairman or a member of the Board of Directors, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of his position to gain a benefit for himself or for others.
A member of the Board of Directors may dispose of his shares in the company during his membership on the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law, the company's contract, or these articles of association.

## Article (39)
Members of the Board of Directors may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly meetings, or to third parties any company secrets they have become aware of in the course of their management duties. Otherwise, they shall be subject to removal and held liable for compensation for damages resulting from the violation.

## Article (40)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any of its members may not hold membership on the boards of two competing companies, nor participate in any work that would compete with the company, nor trade for his own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity pursued by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to claim compensation from him or to consider the transactions he conducted for his own account as having been conducted for the company's account, unless this was approved by the Ordinary General Assembly.

## Article (41)
The total remuneration of the Chairman and members of the Board of Directors may not be estimated at more than ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to the shareholders.

An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors and to each member of this Board from the date of the company's incorporation until it achieves profits that allow it to distribute remunerations in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a resolution of the company's General Assembly, an independent board member may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration limit (if the company has independent members).
The Board of Directors shall submit an annual report to be presented to the company's Ordinary General Assembly for approval, which shall include a precise and detailed statement of all amounts, benefits, and advantages received by the Board of Directors, whatever their nature or designation.

**Article (42)**
No person who has a representative on the Board of Directors, nor the Chairman or any member of the Board of Directors, nor any member of the executive management, nor their spouses or relatives of the second degree, may have a direct or indirect interest in the contracts and transactions concluded with or for the account of the company, unless authorized by the Ordinary General Assembly.

**Article (43)**
The company may not grant a loan to any of its board members, the Chief Executive Officer, their spouses, or their relatives up to the second degree, or to their subsidiary companies, unless there is an authorization from the company's Ordinary General Assembly. Any act carried out in violation of this shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of a third party acting in good faith.
(This provision does not apply to companies that are permitted to grant loans)

**Article (44)**
The Chairman of the Board of Directors and its members are liable to the company, the shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of power, and for any violation of the law or the company's contract, or for mismanagement.
A vote by the General Assembly to discharge the Board of Directors from liability shall not prevent the filing of a liability claim. Members of the Board of Directors may not participate in voting on the General Assembly's resolutions concerning their discharge from liability for their management, or those related to a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or concerning a dispute between them and the company.

**Article (45)**
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either a personal liability attaching to a specific member, or a joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable for paying compensation, except for any member who objected to the resolution that gave rise to the liability and had their objection recorded in the minutes.

**Article (46)**
The company may file a liability claim against the members of the Board of Directors for errors that result in damages to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall file the claim.

**Article (47)**
Any shareholder may individually file a liability claim on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party to the lawsuit so that compensation, if any is due, may be awarded to it. A shareholder may also file a personal claim for compensation if the error has caused them harm. Any agreement to the contrary shall be void.

**Article (84)**
## B - The General Assembly
The annual Ordinary General Assembly shall convene upon the invitation of the Board of Directors within three months following the end of the fiscal year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may call for a General Assembly meeting whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must call for a General Assembly meeting upon a reasoned request from a number of shareholders holding ten percent of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the party calling for the meeting.
The procedures for calling the General Assembly, the quorum for attendance, and voting shall be subject to the provisions for the Constituent Assembly as stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its amendments.

**Article (49)**
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of shares they hold, has the right to attend the General Assembly and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes assigned to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote for themselves or on behalf of their representative on matters related to a special benefit for them, or a dispute between them and the company. Any condition or resolution to the contrary shall be void. A shareholder may appoint a proxy to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose.
Anyone claiming a right to shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the Judge of Summary Matters to obtain an order upon a petition to bar the disputed shares from voting for a period determined by the issuing judge or until the substance of the dispute is decided by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.

**Article (50)**
Voting for candidates for membership of the Board of Directors shall be subject to the cumulative voting system, which grants each shareholder a voting power equal to the number of shares they own, whereby they have the right to cast all their votes for one candidate or distribute them among the candidates of their choice without repeating these votes.

**Article (51)**
The General Assembly meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors, his deputy, or whomever the Board of Directors delegates for that purpose, or whomever the General Assembly elects from among the shareholders or others.

**Article (52)**
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly, in its annual meeting, is competent to adopt resolutions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, including in particular the following:
1 - The Board of Directors' report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended fiscal year.
2 - The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3 - A report on any violations detected by regulatory authorities for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4 - The company's financial statements.
5 - The Board of Directors' proposals regarding the distribution of profits.
6 - Discharging the members of the Board of Directors from liability.
7 - Electing or removing members of the Board of Directors and determining their remuneration.
8 - Appointing the company's auditor and determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors to do so.
9 - A report on transactions that have been or will be conducted with related parties. Related parties are defined in accordance with international accounting principles.

## Article (53)
By a resolution of the company's Ordinary General Assembly, the chairman, one or more members of the Board of Directors may be dismissed, or the Board of Directors may be dissolved and a new Board of Directors elected. This shall be based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders holding no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital.
Upon the issuance of a resolution to dissolve the Board of Directors, and if it is not possible to elect a new board at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either that the current board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until a new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary management committee whose primary task shall be to call the General Assembly to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

## Article (54)
The Ordinary General Assembly may not discuss topics not listed on the agenda, unless they are urgent matters that have arisen after the preparation of the agenda or are discovered during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority, the auditor, or a number of shareholders holding five percent of the company's capital. If it becomes apparent during the discussion that the information regarding some of the matters presented is insufficient, the meeting shall be postponed for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders representing one-quarter of the issued capital. The postponed meeting shall be convened without the need for new convocation procedures.

## Article (55)
The Board of Directors must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly, unless such resolutions are in violation of the law, the Memorandum of Association, or these Articles of Association.
The Board of Directors must resubmit the violating resolutions to the Ordinary General Assembly in a meeting convened to discuss the aspects of the violation.

## Article (56)
The provisions relating to the Ordinary General Assembly shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

## Article (57)
The Extraordinary General Assembly shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors or upon a reasoned request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital, or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors must call the Extraordinary General Assembly to convene within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors does not call the General Assembly to convene within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry shall call for the meeting within a period of fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

## Article (58)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be sent for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by shareholders representing more than half of the issued capital.
Resolutions shall be passed by a majority of more than half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

## Article (59)
Without prejudice to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly is competent to deal with the following matters:
1 – Amending the company's contract.
2 – Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other manner.
3 – Dissolving, merging, transforming, or dividing the company.
4 – Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.

## Article (60)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly shall not be effective until after the completion of publication procedures.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, its purposes, or its capital.

## Article (61)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit to nullify any resolution issued by the Board of Directors or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly that violates the law, the company's Memorandum of Association, or these Articles of Association, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation where appropriate.
It is also permissible to challenge resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies that are prejudicial to the rights of the minority. The challenge may be made by a number of the company's shareholders who own fifteen percent of the company's issued capital and who did not approve of those resolutions.

## Article (62)
The company's fiscal year shall begin on the first of January and end on the 31st of December of each year, with the exception of the first fiscal year, which shall begin from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register and end on the 31st of December of the following fiscal year.

## Article (63)
A percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted annually by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The Assembly may suspend this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not permit the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of a voluntary reserve that allows for the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What has been deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years permit, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
Additionally, (1%) of the company's net profit shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.

## Article (64)
A deduction shall be made annually from the gross profits (to be determined by the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor) for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities, or for their repair. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

## Article (65)
The General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the obligations incumbent upon the company under labor and social security laws.
A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

## Article (66)
A percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a voluntary reserve allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.

## Article (67)
The General Assembly may, upon the proposal of the Board of Directors, distribute profits to the shareholders at the end of the fiscal year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and must not affect the company's paid-up capital.

## Auditor
## Article (68)
The provisions of the articles contained in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> No. 1/2016 and its amendments, specifically Articles 227 through 233, shall apply.

## Article (69)
At the end of each fiscal year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet and a profit and loss statement for itself and all its subsidiaries, accompanied by notes and data as required by International Accounting Standards.

## Article (70)
## Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
The company shall be subject to the matters stipulated in Articles 266 through 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations.

## Article (71)
The liquidation of the company shall be carried out as set forth in the provisions of Articles 278 through 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations.

## Article (72)
The provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> No. 1/2016 and its amendments and executive regulations shall apply to all matters for which no special provision is made in the Articles of Association or in these Bylaws.

## Article (73)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's head office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file at the competent department of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

## Article (74)
The founders declare the following:
First: That they have subscribed to all shares and have deposited the legally required portion of their value in a local bank at the disposal of the company.
Second: That they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies to manage the company.
Third: The papers and documents supporting the aforementioned declarations are kept with the official editor.

# Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>المجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>
## Announcement
The General Secretariat announces its desire to issue Auction No. (1-2025/2026) for the operation of a light-food cafeteria in the building of the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>. # National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig>
## Announcement
The National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig> announces Tender No. M.W.TH.F.A. 10-2025/2026 for shipping the publications of the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters to external book fairs.
Specialized companies wishing to participate in this tender may obtain the tender documents for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.), only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, from the Financial Affairs Department – Contracts Section – Second Floor – National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters building – Al-Shuhada Street – Sharq.
The following must be observed:
1- The tender is indivisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
2- The deadline for submitting bids is within (10) working days from the date of this announcement's publication in the Kuwait Today <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> newspaper).
4- All documents must be submitted on three (3) CDs, with the exception of the (Bid Form, Preliminary Insurance, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the Tenderer's Data Form).
5- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested tenderers to attend the bid-opening session, after coordinating with the Procurement Supervision (Contracts Section) before the day scheduled for the bid-opening session.

# Public Authority for Agriculture and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>
## Announcement
The Authority announces Tender No. H.Z./M.S./2/2025-2026 for the renewal of Oracle licenses. Companies and institutions may obtain the tender document by submitting a letter expressing their desire to purchase the tender, signed by the authorized signatory of the company or institution, during official working hours from the Financial Affairs Department (Tenders Section) at the Authority – Al-Rabia – Ghazali Street.

<table_caption>Tender Schedule and Fees for Oracle License Renewal (Tender No. H.Z./M.S./2/2025-2026)</table_caption>
<table>
| Preliminary Meeting | Closing Date | Price | Guarantee |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 10 days after the date of publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) | 20 days after the date of publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) | 75/- K.D. | 1,750/- K.D. valid for (90) days |
</table>

The preliminary meeting will be held at 10:00 AM in the meeting hall at the office of the Director of the Information Systems Center Department.

- The above-mentioned fee shall be paid by a certified check or K-Net card.
- Any reservations or inquiries regarding the aforementioned tender must be submitted within one week from the date of the tender announcement; otherwise, such requests will not be considered.
- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
- This tender is restricted to companies and institutions specialized in this field and registered with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig> for the year 2025.
- A valid certificate of the company's registration with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> must be submitted upon purchasing the tender documents.
- A valid certificate of the company's registration in the supplier registry of the Public Authority for Agriculture and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> must be submitted upon purchasing the tender documents.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copiable CD, with the exception of the Bid Form and the Preliminary Insurance, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the tenderer's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 regarding work in the private sector. Note that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing the documents, in accordance with the provisions of Article 39 of Law No. 74/2019 concerning amendments to the Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the tender must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- This announcement is an integral part of the tender documents.

# Public Authority for Agriculture and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>
## Announcement

# ANNOUNCEMENT

The Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> announces the issuance of Public Tender No. P.A.S. (14/2025/2026) regarding the maintenance works for the tennis courts at Al-Yarmouk Sports Club <orig>نادي اليرموك الرياضي</orig>.
This will be conducted through sealed envelopes in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the tender documents, which can be obtained from the Services and Procurement Department – Tenders and Practices Section – Ground Floor, Office No. (5) at the Authority's headquarters in the Al-Riqqa'i <orig>الرقعي</orig> area during official working hours, or through the Public Authority for Sport's website (Pas.gov.kw/tenders).

<table_caption>Tender Schedule and Fees</table_caption>
<table>
| Issuance Date | Closing Date | Document Price | Initial Guarantee |
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---|
| 2025/08/10 | 2025/08/26 | 75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> | K.D. 1,500 (only one thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars) in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee valid for a period of (90) days in favor of the Public Authority for Sport from the closing date. |
</table>

- A preliminary meeting for bidders has been scheduled at the Authority's headquarters (First Floor) at 11:00 AM on Tuesday, 2025/08/19.
- Bids must be submitted starting from 9:00 AM until 2:00 PM on the closing date. Bids must be delivered in red-wax sealed envelopes and placed in the designated tender box at the Authority's headquarters (Ground Floor). Any bids received after the specified deadline for the tender closing will not be accepted.
- Bidders must adhere to the instructions regarding the submission of bids (CD) on the Public Authority for Sport's website (Pas.gov.kw/tenders).
- Companies/bidders wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must do so at the time and place specified above for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). No inquiries will be considered after this deadline.
- All documents must be submitted on a CD and a non-reproducible hard copy, with the exception of the bid form and the initial guarantee, which must be submitted as a hard copy.
- Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of bid opening. Any bid not accompanied by the original or a copy of the receipt for the purchase of the tender documents, the initial guarantee, and the national labor support certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> for the year 2025 will be disqualified.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority, nor any of the violations mentioned in Article (10) of Law No. 8 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. It should be noted that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> stating clearance of consumption debts.
- The tender is open to all companies and institutions specialized in the required works and registered with the Public Authority for Sport and the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2025, for a fee of (K.D. 75) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars, payable via K-Net (non-refundable except in cases stipulated by Ministry of Finance circulars). The following must be brought:
1- A copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette.
2- A copy of the company's registration with the Authority for the year 2025.
3- A written authorization letter approved by the Authority, accompanied by (a copy of the Civil ID – a copy of the signature authorization).
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing tender documents in accordance with the provisions of Article (39) of Law No. 74 of 2019 regarding amendments to the Public Tenders Law No. 49 of 2016.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the tender must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> certifying their status as a small or medium enterprise.
- In accordance with the provisions of Article (48) of the Public Tenders Law No. 49 of 2016, which states, "Bid envelopes shall be opened at the time and place specified in the tender documents in a public session in the presence of the bidders or their representatives."
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend. Companies wishing to attend the bid opening session have the right to coordinate with the competent committee before the day of the session.
- This announcement is an integral part of the tender documents.
Note: The Authority may cancel the tender without stating reasons and without any objection from the bidders.
For more information, please visit the Public Authority for Sport's website (Pas.gov.kw).

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> Circular No. (21) of 2025
Regarding the Guidance Manual for Combating the Financing of Proliferation
"Circular to all Licensed Persons"

In the context of strengthening national efforts to combat the financing of terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, and based on Recommendation (7) of the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) recommendations, related to the implementation of targeted financial sanctions imposed pursuant to Security Council resolutions, you will find attached the Guidance Manual addressed to all units subject to the supervision of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, to be considered a primary reference within your approved internal policies and procedures, ensuring full awareness of its content by relevant parties and working to implement it accurately and seriously, in order to achieve full compliance with relevant national and international applications.
Please note that compliance with the contents of this Manual will be subject to follow-up by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> during monitoring or oversight activities, through which your full adherence to the mandatory procedures contained in the Manual will be verified, to limit attempts to finance the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, taking into account that non-compliance with the above may expose you to the measures and penalties stipulated in Article (15) of Law No. 106 of 2013 regarding combating money laundering and terrorist financing.

## Announcement 87/2025
The holder of the following license has applied to the Municipality:
<table_caption>License Holder Details</table_caption>
<table>
| Trade Name | Kuwait Engineering Establishment for General Building Contracting <orig>مؤسسة الهندسه الكويتية للمقاولات العامة للمباني</orig> |
| :--- | :--- |
| Category | Municipality Contractor |
| Registration Number | 7200482 |
</table>
requesting the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality in exchange for its classification.
Pursuant to Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (161/2009) concerning the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiration or to cancel their classification, and the committee stipulated in the first article of these regulations may issue its decision to that effect after the fulfillment of the following two conditions: -
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- The lapse of (15) fifteen days from the date of publishing this request in the Official Gazette.
The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the return of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone with any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding building construction contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial liens in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the construction contract, to contact the Contractors Section at the Engineering Systems Department within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the specified period.
Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

# Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>
## Announcement No. (86/2025 G)
Redistribution of (68) Stalls in Souk Al-Hareem <orig>سوق الحريم</orig> in the Al-Mubarakiya Markets <orig>أسواق المباركية</orig> Area
The Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> announces to citizens the redistribution of (68) stalls in Souk Al-Hareem <orig>سوق الحريم</orig> in the Al-Mubarakiya Markets <orig>أسواق المباركية</orig> area for utilization in accordance with the terms and conditions stipulated in the Public Markets Regulation issued by Ministerial Resolution No. (118/2023). Those interested who meet the terms and conditions should submit their applications, accompanied by supporting documents, to the Food and Markets Monitoring Section at the Audit and Municipal Services Follow-up Department, Capital Governorate Municipality Branch in Shuwaikh, behind the Passports and Immigration Department, from: 08/24/2025 G to: 08/28/2025 G during official working hours. Applications submitted before this announcement or after the application deadline will not be considered. Please note that the selection will be conducted by public lottery.

## Announcement
Announcement regarding the list of companies invited to participate in Limited Tender No. (CB/CMS/2079)
Personnel for KNPC Refineries

> The Higher Procurement Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries, upon the request of the Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig>, announces the list of companies invited to participate in Limited Tender No. (CB/CMS/2079) Laboratory Personnel for KNPC Refineries.
> In this regard, we draw your attention to the fact that, based on the text of Article (16) of Law No. (49) of 2016 regarding Public Tenders <orig>القانون رقم (49) لسنة 2016 بشأن المناقصات العامة</orig>, the aforementioned tender will be offered to the following list of (23) companies at least (30) days after the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>).
> A fee of (250 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) must be paid for grievance requests to add a company's name to the lists of limited tenders. The deposit receipt into the account of the Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig> (KW40NBOK0000000000002036478748) must be attached to the request submitted for this purpose to the Secretariat of the Higher Procurement Committee.
